user.title: ADSB Aircraft Tracker Setup
user.description:
Connect to your ADSB feeder to track aircraft in real-time. This integration works with dump1090, tar1090, and compatible feeders on your network.

**Quick Setup:** Most users can simply enter their ADSB feeder's IP address and use the defaults.

data_description.adsb_host: IP address of your ADSB feeder (e.g., 192.168.1.100). Find this in your feeder's web interface or network settings.
data_description.adsb_port: Port number where your feeder serves aircraft data. Default is 8085 for tar1090. Check your feeder's configuration if unsure.
data_description.update_interval: How often to refresh aircraft data. Recommended: 10 seconds (range: 5-300). Lower values = more real-time data but higher system load.
data_description.distance_limit: Maximum distance to track aircraft. Units (miles/kilometers) depend on your Home Assistant unit system. Set to 0 for unlimited range (tracks all aircraft your feeder can see). Typical range: 50-200 miles or 80-320 km depending on your antenna setup.

summary.title: Setup Complete!
summary.description:
{summary_text}

Your ADSB feeder connection has been validated successfully. You can now choose to configure notifications or finish the basic setup.

notifications.title: Configure Key Notifications
notifications.description: Set up the most important alerts for your ADSB tracker. You can configure additional settings later in the integration options.

data_description.notification_device: Select your mobile device to receive aircraft alerts. Leave empty to disable notifications. Only shows devices with the Home Assistant mobile app installed.
data_description.external_url: Website URL to open when tapping notification alerts. Default uses your local ADSB feeder. Popular options: https://globe.adsb.fi or https://tar1090.adsbexchange.com for global aircraft tracking.
data_description.military_notifications: Get notified when military aircraft are detected nearby. Uses verified database with 16,000+ confirmed military aircraft to prevent false positives. Perfect for aviation enthusiasts and plane spotters.
data_description.emergency_notifications: Receive immediate alerts for aviation emergency codes: 7700 (general emergency), 7600 (radio failure), 7500 (hijack). These are critical aviation safety signals that are rare but important to monitor.
data_description.close_aircraft_enabled: Receive alerts when aircraft pass very close overhead or at low altitude. Great for spotting interesting aircraft in your immediate area and monitoring air traffic patterns.

error.cannot_connect: Failed to connect to ADSB source. Check host and port.
error.invalid_adsb_data: Invalid ADSB data format. Ensure your feeder is compatible.

abort.already_configured: This ADSB source is already configured.
